channel.title: Cholesterol Pills
channel.description:
It was announced from the docter I had high cholesterol 6/7 months ago. 3/4 months later, I took a diet and it decreased by 34. Then, 4/5 months later (today), it was announced my cholesterol got lower by 2. The doctor said I need to take cholesterol pills, and I'm scared to take them. My parents don't even want me to take them. Idk what to do >.>
[table] [tr] [td]1st time[/td] [td][/td] [td]268 cholesterol[/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]2nd time[/td] [td][/td] [td]234 cholesterol[/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]3rd time[/td] [td][/td] [td]232 cholesterol[/td] [/tr] [/table]
Don't know what the pills do? They can hurt your liver.

item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“thakillah, post:12, topic:465657”]I have kidney disease I have every day to the hospital for dialysis for a year that I often have to watch my cholesterol , otherwise I have to take pills that’s the worstx

Gl mate remember always stay happy no matther what[/quote]they said the same thing for my dad, but from what we have gathered you can also keep stuff like that down from not eating stuff such as butter, the skins on chicken, etc.

oh? here in the communist republic of the united kingdom and northern island our doctors do not see patients as cash cows, it must be the capitalist pigdog america who has brainwashed american doctors into healing for their own gain[/quote]

When will Americans understand that they are getting fucked in the ass?

Niall: I’m just curious, has UK ever been compared to the Soviet Union by any serious people?

item.title: Cholesterol Pills
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Another option would be to take Omega-3 pills.

http://www.mayoclinic.com/health/cholesterol/CL00002

My dad started to take Omega-3 about a year ago and is all big into it since his cholesterol is down.

Read full topic

item.title: Cholesterol Pills
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:11, topic:465657”]I’ve never met a 12 year old with high cholesterol.

Maybe it has something to do with the fact that you seem to be very active on your computer, put it down for a while and go play with your friends.[/quote]

[quote=“arham 4, post:5, topic:465657”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=571496.msg4136263#msg4136263 date=1351729612]
High cholesterol at age 12? Do you not eat healthy or do you have some sort of blood disease? As for the pills, just do some Google research.
[/quote]
It’s inherited from my dad.[/quote]

Read full topic

like any medicinal item, it has a pro but there is always a con.

item.title: Cholesterol Pills
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

Just remember once you go on those pills your doctor will never advise you to go off them and continue to lower the “standard” level because its an insurance gold mine.

It’s a shame how when Doctors see patients coming now-a-days they think “Here comes our payday!”.
